title: Tomero 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Stalky, burnt aromas are gritty and not fully clean or appealing. A grabby, raw, tannic palate is rough and grating, while this tastes much like the nose suggests: stalky and tomatoey. Heavy tannins and a mild but steady burn add to the toughness of this Cabernet.

title: Emina 2014 Sauvignon (Rueda)
description: Citrus and tropical-fruit aromas are basic. This feels plump and, yet again, basic. Vegetal flavors of bell pepper finish with hints of citrus as well as pyrazinic green notes.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Xairel Red (Tejo)
description: The wine is soft, fruity and with its light tannins and fresh red berry fruits, it is ready to drink. The aftertaste has a fresh, bright finish. Drink now.

title: Bread & Butter 2013 Chardonnay (California)
description: The color is quite deep and golden, the aroma is earthy and the flavors are strong, grapy and very ripe. This wine is full bodied and almost sweet.

title: Hanson Vineyards 2012 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a rough, rustic, country red, with little varietal character and none of the elegance of Pinot Noir. Tart, light strawberry fruit is smothered in chewy, earthy tannins.

title: Paranoia 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A light color goes along with light plum and red cherry flavors, a soft texture and light to medium body. This wine is pleasant and straightforward.

title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Terra Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: The wine is dry, not showing much fruit. It has a hard, bitter, extracted edge that is tough and firm. The wine could develop, although the dry texture is likely to remain.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Vega de la Reina Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Grapefruit and other citrusy aromas come with a dusty note. This shows peachy weight, then leesy flavors of stone fruits and mango that are soft and lightly oxidized.

title: Las Valles 2014 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Citrus and floral aromas are mild. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay feels round and chunky, but hardly stocky. Bland flavors of orange and grapefruit fall off on the finish.

title: Quinta da Foz 2014 Vinha da Foz Red (Douro)
description: Juicy red fruits dominate this simple approachable wine. It is fresh with crisp red berries and just a light structure. There is a tight, tangy aftertaste that brings out acidity. Drink from late 2016.

title: Pata Negra 2014 Chardonnay (Penedès)
description: Round, slightly oxidized aromas of apricot and nectarine are briny. This feels citrusy but in need of a focal point. Flavors of citrus and stone fruits are slightly nutty due to early onset oxidation, while the finish tastes of sea brine and stale citrus.

title: Pata Negra 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Sweaty sautéed onion and pyrazinic citrus aromas set up a palate with citric acidity and dominant flavors of white grapefruit. Pithy and citric on the finish, with strong Sauvignon-like residual flavors.

title: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas Organic Verdejo (Spain)
description: Lightly floral aromas are dilute while hinting at quince jelly. There's not a lot of vitality to the palate, while tangerine and nectarine flavors are watery. Pithy citrus notes carry the finish before it putters out.

title: Wine with Spirit 2015 Bastardo! Black Edition Branco White (Tejo)
description: This is a fresh and bright wine. It has tangy acidity, a citrus character and a zesty aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Wyncroft 2013 Wren Song Riesling (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Lemon pith and ripe peach aromas are clouded under a distinctly medicinal tone of baby aspirin. While there is nice roundness to the palate and balanced acidity to boot, the flavors are mild showings of orchard fruit and lemon curd.

title: Casa Montes 2014 Ampakama Chardonnay (San Juan)
description: Tropical aromas revolve around lemon-lime. This is acidic without much body. Flavors of lemon, melon, mango and green apple are lean and finish with tangy, pithy citrus flavors.

title: Albet I Noya 2014 XA Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: Bland aromas suggest applesauce. This varietal Xarello feels plump but flat. Candied, generic white-fruit flavors are nonspecific, while this offers up citrus notes and pyrazines on the finish.

title: Luis Segundo Correas 2013 Valle Las Acequias Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Wiry, briary currant and herbal aromas announce a hard but juicy wine with buttery oak, salty red fruit flavors and a loud herbal angle. This is both briny tasting and a touch weedy on the finish.

title: Michael-Scott 2013 Zinfandel (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Pruney and somewhat reduced, this thick offering of chocolate and blackberry jam needs food to mellow it out, preferably meat covered thickly in sauce.

title: JAQK Cellars 2013 High Roller Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Meant to provide value, this wine also offers big oak, smoke and a bittersweet taste of black-tea tannins. Shy in fruit, this has a slightly reduced effect on the finish.

title: Gracianna 2014 Suzanne's Blend Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Apple skin and guava rise out from a more buttery aroma that leads to oak on the palate. Light bodied, the wine finishes tart in lemon and lime.

title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a rich, full wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. With balanced acidity, only a hint of tannins, it is ready to drink.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Quartilho Branco White (Tejo)
description: This is a gentle, ripe wine that has pineapple and peach flavors and fresh fruitiness. It is smooth with balanced acidity and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 White (Tejo)
description: A young, fresh blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is fruity, light and with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Verterra 2014 Dry Gewurztraminer (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: Muddled aromas of tangerine, grapefruit and papaya seem a bit soapy in character. The palate feels a bit underripe, showing milky florals upfront and unconcentrated citrus on the back.

title: Three Fires 2013 Unoaked Chardonnay (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Faint notes of yuzu rise over underripe peach in this unoaked Chardonnay. The light-bodied palate shows a mild concentration of lemon leading to a short but clean finish.

title: Schmidt 2012 Pinot Noir (Applegate Valley)
description: Somewhat disjointed flavors mix subtle red fruits with cracker, licorice and coffee. So far the components have not smoothed out. It's a flavor jumble.

title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bastardo! Black Edition Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: The wine is fresh with red berry flavors and a stalky tannic core. It's lightly perfumed, light in texture and ready to drink.

title: Wine with Spirit 2014 Seafood & Co White (Vinho Verde)
description: There is an attractive, light prickle on the tongue of this fresh, crisp and fruity wine. It is dry, tensely tangy with a green, zesty character. Drink now.

title: Gustafson Family 2012 Mountain Cuvée Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the producer's Old Vineyard Block, and blended with 20% Petite Sirah and 5% Syrah, this wine has a rustic barnyardy quality. It offers a tightness of dried herb around broad, sweet tannins, strawberry jam and chocolate.
